net.realmproject.dcm.event.sender

Interface DeviceEventSender

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DeviceEventBus
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDeviceEventSender, CommandDevice, ConnectedCommandDevice, Device, DeviceMessageDecoder, HeartbeatCommandDevice, IDeviceEventBus, IDeviceEventBusForwarder, IDeviceEventBusSender, SimpleDevice, TestAnnotatedCommandDevice, TestAnnotatedCommandDevice

    public interface DeviceEventSender
    A DeviceEventSender is anything which sends events. It is not required that it generate events of it's own.
    Author:
    maxweld, NAS

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean hasSent()
      Returns true if this component has sent events since sending of events was enabled.
      boolean isSending()
      Is sending of events turned on?
      long sendCount()
      The number of events events which have been sent by this component since it started sending events.
      void setSending(boolean sending)
      Set if this component is currently sending events.
      void startSending()
      If this component is not currently sending events, start sending them now.
      void stopSending()
      If this component is currently sending events, stop sending them now.

    • Method Detail

      • isSending

        boolean isSending()
        Is sending of events turned on?
        Returns:
        true if this component is currently sending events, false otherwise

      • setSending

        void setSending(boolean sending)
        Set if this component is currently sending events. There is no backlog of unsent events retained. Events "sent" while this component was not sending are lost.
        Parameters:
        sending - whether to send events or not

      • startSending

        void startSending()
        If this component is not currently sending events, start sending them now. There is no backlog of unsent events retained. Events "sent" while this component was not sending are lost.

      • stopSending

        void stopSending()
        If this component is currently sending events, stop sending them now. There is no backlog of unsent events retained. Events "sent" while this component was not sending are lost.

      • hasSent

        boolean hasSent()
        Returns true if this component has sent events since sending of events was enabled. Disabling sending of events will reset this counter to 0
        Returns:
        true if events have been sent, false otherwise

      • sendCount

        long sendCount()
        The number of events events which have been sent by this component since it started sending events. Disabling sending of events will reset this counter to 0
        Returns:
        number of sent messages
